channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COVID-19 cluster emerges at Melbourne meatworks; AFL hoping for June reboot

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases pass 3.3 million, Australian death toll stands at 93, Prime Minister Scott Morrison said national rules could soon be eased

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Stood down en masse, AFL assistant coaches, including famous names, have found work in strange places: as farm hands, working for a place that recycles dead animals, in juvenile detention and the faraway mines.
item.title: Farm hand, kids detention, dead animal recycling: AFL coaches' new reality

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Will it be Melbourne? Will it be country Victoria, Albury or Sydney? Melbourne Storm are confident they will definitely find out on Sunday whether they can begin training in their home state or have to move across the border to prepare for the return of the NRL season.
item.title: Storm to find out Sunday where they will train for NRL return

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Usman Khawaja accused Cricket Australia of financial "mismanagement" as hopes were raised the doomsday scenario of a summer without international matches can be avoided.
item.title: 'Business 101': Khawaja launches broadside at Cricket Australia

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: Little did the Brisbane high school graduate know her work would end up at GOMA, seen at a distance during a global pandemic.
item.title: In a world sitting on edge, a yellow house sits on ice

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: We're always told to have a positive outlook but new research has shown that by doing so we can improve our physical health as well as our mental wellbeing.
item.title: Going easy on yourself can make you healthier as well as happier

item.description: A five-year-old mare who started her career running around on dirt tracks in the United States looks well placed to break her maiden at the Sapphire Coast.
item.title: Dale ready to pull a rabbit out of his hat at Sapphire Coast

item.description: All you need to know for Sunday's seven-race meeting at Sapphire Coast.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Sapphire Coast on Sunday

item.dc:creator: Damien Ractliffe
item.description: Local Morphettville trainer Will Clarken caused a boilover in the group 1 Sangster Stakes with tried horse Bella Vella prevailing in a "fairytale story" for connections.
item.title: Tried horse claims Sangster, Thornton wins maiden group 1

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Meanwhile, new guidelines could pave the way for swimmers to return to the pool, dance classes to resume and small groups of footballers to do non-contact training drills together.
item.title: Investigation into possible breaches of infection protocols at Newmarch House

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: A plastic engineering firm in Malaga has been tasked with manufacturing 10,000 face shields for the state's health workers, as Australia moves away from its reliance on international supply lines.
item.title: 'Hat trick': WA records no new COVID-19 cases as government secures local production of PPE

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Winx's rider was rarely out of the winner's stall on a day where he rode winners for five different stables.
item.title: Hugh's beauty lands five winners as Bowman warms up chilly Randwick

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: Australian Rugby League Commission chairman and Racing NSW boss Peter V'landys won't move the $15 million race despite it now falling in a busy sporting period.
item.title: V'landys refuses to move mountain to avoid Everest-NRL finals clash

item.description: Usman Khawaja has expressed disappointment at Cricket Australia's financial "mismanagement", admitting he was shocked to learn of its cash-flow woes.
item.title: 'To me that's business 101': Khawaja shocked by CA cash-flow crisis

item.description: The fire was reported just after 11.35am on Saturday near an intersection on Newnham Road, with people west of Old Coast Road between Preston Beach Road and Old Bunbury Road in danger and urged to shelter indoors to survive, while some roads will be closed for motorists.
item.title: Raging bushfire threatens homes, lives in Lake Clifton

item.dc:creator: Lucy Manly
item.description: The couple have confirmed the safe arrival of their daughter, Harper May Stefanovic, in Sydney on Friday.
item.title: 'I am in awe': Karl and Jasmine Stefanovic welcome baby girl

item.dc:creator: Adam Pengilly
item.description: The Australian Sports Foundation is emerging as a lifeline for cash-strapped clubs during COVID-19 with two Sydney clubs at the forefront.
item.title: $15,000 a pop: NRL clubs reach out to fans for funding amid crisis

item.description: Rami Makhlouf, one of Syria's wealthiest businessmen, published a direct video appeal on Facebook after being saddled with huge debts and fines by the regime.
item.title: Humiliating appeal by Assad cousin exposes family feud

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: My experience travelling from Washington to one of America's coronavirus hot spots was remarkably relaxed - at times worryingly so.
item.title: Flying across the US during a pandemic was a breeze

item.dc:creator: Michael Idato
item.description: Someone sent me a thing the other day about Quibi and it sounds like the new Netflix, but I am not sure what it is.
item.title: Bluffer's Guide: What is a Quibi and do I need one?

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: From John Silvester's true crime podcast to a DIY supergroup and live play reading starring Rose Byrne, we have your week covered.
item.title: Best of the week: What to see, hear and do in Sydney from May 3-9

item.dc:creator: Nicole Elphick
item.description: For inspiration during self-isolation, we've asked prominent Australian artists and entertainers to tell us what they are doing at home.
item.title: Home Sweet Home: What's keeping Charlie Pickering busy in isolation

item.dc:creator: Jenna Price
item.description: Working dads are becoming more visible, but will it remain post-pandemic? Six couples tell how they are navigating new parenthood â€” and what the future holds.
item.title: In a crisis, a shift: This is the changing face of fatherhood

item.description: The Hawaiian writer was deeply impressed by Sandra Cisneros' diamond-sharp prose.
item.title: Books That Changed Me: Kawai Strong Washburn

item.description: C Pam Zhang's novel, set during the American gold rush, is about the loneliness of the immigrant.
item.title: Looking at the Wild West through different eyes

item.description: Victorian Giveaways:
item.title: Victorian Giveaways: Win a super pack of board games

item.description: Upside down world
item.title: Sian Prior: Our upside down world

item.description: Ellen and I love each other but we fight a lot. How can we have less drama?
item.title: About Last Night: how can we have less drama?

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Lisa McCune plays a better version of herself opposite screen husband Peter Helliar in How to Stay Married.
item.title: Lisa McCune plays to type in How To Stay Married

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Critics' Choice: Save Me, Desert Collectors Australia, Me@Home, Tales from the Loop
item.title: TV: Critic's Choice for May 3

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Saturday Picks: American Gods, Ancient Aliens, Stepmom
item.title: TV for Saturday, May 9

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Friday Picks: Under the Wire: Life of a War Reporter, Bad Banks, Keep Cooking and Carry On
item.title: TV for Friday, May 8

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Thursday Picks: Britain's Got Talent, The Heights, Blue Bloods
item.title: TV for Thursday, May 7

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Wednesday Picks: You Can't Ask That: Kids, The Secrets She Keeps, Family Guy
item.title: TV for Wednesday, May 6

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Tuesday Picks: Takeshi's Castle, Outback Truckers, Hamish and Andy's "Perfect" Holiday
item.title: TV for Tuesday, May 5

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Monday Picks: Book Hungry Bears, Lady O'Loughlin, Have You Been Paying Attention?
item.title: TV for Monday, May 4

item.dc:creator: Bridget McManus
item.description: Sunday Picks: Kubrick by Kubrick, House Rules, Lego Masters
item.title: TV for Sunday, May 3

item.description: The TV adaptation of Normal People has retained the deceptive simplicity and understated humour of Sally Rooney's novel.
item.title: PAY TV: Normal People

item.dc:creator: Garry Maddox
item.description: The star of the new Australian film Hearts and Bones reflects on the closing of cinemas and how he is making the most of unexpected downtime.
item.title: "It's all gone": Hugo Weaving on life for an actor during lockdown

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Brisbane coach Anthony Seibold has defended the integrity of a shortened season and believes it will be one for the ages when it resumes in late May.
item.title: NRL season will be among most intense in history, says Seibold

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: As of Monday every state school student in the state can access a four week soccer course to get their PE and exercise fix
item.title: Victory to the rescue with free, four-week PE classes for kids

item.dc:creator: Michael Lynch
item.description: Mark Viduka has made a huge impact with his interventions on Australian soccer policy in the past month. Now he and his committee must provide answers.
item.title: When Viduka speaks everyone listens. Now he and his team must deliver

item.description: Authorities said strict measures had led to "significant gains" in containing the spread of COVID-19 and issued new guidelines to regulate economic and other activities.
item.title: Colour-coded India extends lockdown but eases curbs in some areas

item.description: Andy Murray has backed Roger Federer's call to merge the men's and women's tours, saying that many top male players believe it will be a positive step for tennis.
item.title: Andy Murray backs calls for ATP-WTA merger

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Queensland Health is urgently tracing passengers who were on a Melbourne to Brisbane Qantas flight on April 22.
item.title: Public health alert issued over new Queensland coronavirus case

item.description: Police have lined the side of the road and saluted Constable Glen Humphris, as his body was escorted from Victoria to his final resting place.
item.title: Officers salute as the hearse passes by: Constable's body returned home

item.dc:creator: Michael Harry
item.description: A pair of earrings will help you indulge in some sparkle, while wearing your tracksuit and slippers.
item.title: The surprising accessory we're buying in isolation

item.description: The rise and rise of Marnus Labuschagne, who just last year was left off Cricket Australia's contract list, has been nothing short of remarkable.
item.title: 'That schedule will be packed': Marnus ready to make up for lost time

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: A disability worker has been charged with filming and abusing children in his care, in what police say was a "significant breach of trust".
item.title: Carer accused of filming and abusing disabled children
